name: Whitelist Non-Phishing Emails from KnowBe4
title: Whitelist Non-Phishing Emails from KnowBe4
body:
You may have already whitelisted simulated phishing emails and training notifications from KnowBe4 in your system. However, if you're having difficulties receiving any other emails from KnowBe4, such as admin or system-related updates, or emails sent by KnowBe4 employees, this document will cover how to whitelist those types of emails in your Microsoft 365 environment.

The instructions for setting up this rule are shown below.

Note: The setup below describes how to allow emails unrelated to training or phishing to get through Microsoft 365's spam filter. For instructions on how to whitelist our simulated phishing emails and training notifications in your system, check out our related documentation:
  • Whitelisting by IP Address in Exchange 2016
  • How to Whitelist by Email Headers in Microsoft 365 or Microsoft Exchange 2016
  • Or, try our Whitelisting Wizard
  1. Log into your Microsoft 365 portal and go into the Admin > Exchange area.
  2. Click on Service Settings > Mail > Mail Flow.
  3. Click the (+) Create New Rule button beneath Mail Flow > Rules.
  4. Give the rule a name, such as "Whitelist Emails from KnowBe4".
  5. Click on More options....
  6. From the Apply this Rule if... drop-down menu, select The sender's domain is... option.
  7. Enter the following domains: "knowbe4.com" and"knowbe4.zendesk.com".
  8. From the Do the following... drop-down menu, select Modify the message properties... option. 
  9. Click Save. An example of the completed rule is below.
  10. Select set the spam confidence level (SCL).
  11. Select Bypass spam filtering.
  12. Click Save. An example of the completed rule is below. See the below image for an example of a completed rule:

Tip: To ensure that you have whitelisted correctly, see our How to Verify You Have Whitelisted KnowBe4 Correctly article.

images.alt:
This image displays a configuration screen for creating or editing an email transport rule, titled "Whitelist Emails from KnowBe4."

**Configuration Sections and Elements:**

1.  **Name:** An input field, currently populated with the text "Whitelist Emails from KnowBe4."

2.  **\*Apply this rule if... (Conditions):**
    *   A dropdown menu showing the selected condition: "The sender's domain is..."
    *   Associated text specifies the domains: "'knowbe4.mail.intercom.io' or 'knowbe4.com'."
    *   An "add condition" button is present below.

3.  **\*Do the following... (Actions):**
    *   A dropdown menu showing the selected action: "Set the spam confidence level (SCL) to..."
    *   A informational note titled "Bypass spam filtering" provides context, stating that creating a transport rule is unnecessary for filtering and suggesting an "allow or block list in the spam filter" link for specific senders or domains.
    *   An "add action" button is present below.

4.  **Except if... (Exceptions):**
    *   An "add exception" button is available.

5.  **Properties of this rule:**
    *   **Priority:** An input field set to "0."
    *   **Auditing:** A checkbox labeled "Audit this rule with severity level:" is checked. A dropdown menu is set to "Not specified."

6.  **Choose a mode for this rule:** (Radio buttons)
    *   **Enforce** (Selected)
    *   Test with Policy Tips
    *   Test without Policy Tips

7.  **Activation/Deactivation Scheduling:**
    *   **Activate this rule on the following date:** A checkbox is unchecked, followed by date and time selectors (Mon 7/11/2016 and 11:30 AM).
    *   **Deactivate this rule on the following date:** A checkbox is unchecked, followed by date and time selectors (Mon 7/11/2016 and 11:30 AM).

8.  **Additional Settings:**
    *   **Stop processing more rules:** A checkbox is checked.
    *   **Defer the message if rule processing doesn't complete:** A checkbox is unchecked.
    *   **Match sender address in message:** A dropdown menu is set to "Header."
